intro: Helicia finisterrae, commonly known as the Cape Verde ebony, is a rare and endemic species native to the Cape Verde Islands. It is a small evergreen tree or shrub characterized by its dark, glossy leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant belongs to the family Ericaceae and is adapted to the arid and rocky conditions of its native habitat. Its fruits are small, woody capsules that contain seeds dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Helicia finisterrae is considered a vulnerable species.
